translated: Jātaka
The Group of Three🔽The Chapter on the Inner Part
The Sīlavīmaṁsaka Jātaka
“Virtue, it seems, is good,
virtue is unsurpassed in the world;
See the terrible-fanged nāga,
because of virtue he is not killed.
I, having considered virtue,
approved in the world, auspicious;
Conducting myself in the noble way,
by which one is called virtuous.
He is dear to his relatives,
and shines among his friends;
At the break-up of the body, the virtuous one
is reborn in a good place.”🔽The Sīlavīmaṁsaka Jātaka is the tenth.
The fourth chapter is called The Chapter on the Inner Part.🔽The summary:
Tree, best of the Kaṁsavaru, tiger, deer,
Jewels, jewel, sāluka, avhayano,
Instruction, and best of the fish,
Maṇikuṇḍala, kirena, ten.
